alert.note: Alert for Owens Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 08 at 8:08PM PST until March 12 at 4:00AM PST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: .Heavy rain may fall on a deep snowpack, leading to the melt increasing. Flows in rivers may increase quickly and reach critical levels. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of southeast California, including the following areas, Eastern Sierra Slopes and Owens Valley. * WHEN...From Thursday afternoon through late Saturday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A strong atmospheric river will impact the Eastern Sierra Slopes and Owens Valley late Thursday afternoon through early Sunday morning, fueling heavy rain and snow. Snow levels will rise to around 8000 to 9000 feet Thursday night, then fall to 7000 to 8000 feet Friday night. Rain falling on significant low-elevation snowpack will have the potential to result in increased runoff and flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
